page.title: 14BANCHORY-DEVENICK CHURCH I
page.content: Built in{1822,}the church stands on an ancient holy site where several thousand bodies are buried in the cemetery. There is an{iron coffin which was used to keep a new corpse safe during the time of the Bodysnatchers. The church has a small bell tower with a weather cock. A toilet was added but a balcony has been removed.There are{no stained {glass windows}but a beautiful embroidered alter cloth was made by the Laird's wife. Banchory-Devenick communion plates are kept in The Bank of Scotland. Communion is to celebrate The Last Supper and to confirm your faith. About{65% of the 212 members attend regularly travelling from different parts. Within this area live members of Maryculter Church and Portlethen Church also.
